tool.name: Count alignments
tool.command: mkdir outputdir && #for $file in $input_list samtools index '$file' && #end for python $__tool_directory__/bamparse.py --alignments #for $file in $input_list '$file' #end for --labels #for $file in $input_list '$file.element_identifier' #end for --polarity '$polarity' --number '$output_option'

param.name: polarity
param.label: how to count sense and antisense reads
param.option: count both sense and antisense reads

param.name: output_option
param.label: Select the number of files for results
param.help: Results can be returned either as a single multi-column table or in separate two-column datasets (useful for DESeq subsequent analysis)
param.option: One separate two-columns dataset per input bam alignment

tool.help:
**What it does**
Counts the number of reads aligned to each reference (@SN, reference NAME) in one or several BAM alignments.
Sense, antisense or both sense and antisense alignments can be counted
The library labels in the returned count table are taken from the input bam datasets names in the Galaxy history.
